Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of NPC-21 for CMV Prevention in Kidney Transplant Recipients

Trial_Design.evidence: multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, phase 2 trial

Participants.evidence: Adult KT recipients aged 18-75 years were enrolled from centers in the United States and Japan.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomized in a 4:1:4 ratio to receive monthly 6 mg/kg NPC-21, 12 mg/kg NPC-21, or placebo.

Objective.evidence: assessed the efficacy and safety of fiztasovimab (NPC-21), an anti-CMV monoclonal antibody, in kidney transplant (KT) recipients

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was CMV infection by week 16.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was stratified by region using an Interactive Response Technology system, with allocation concealed from investigators and patients.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 87 participants were randomized: 38 to 6 mg/kg NPC-21, 11 to 12 mg/kg NPC-21, and 38 to placebo.

Number_Analysed.evidence: CMV infections occurred in 76.3%, 81.8%, and 68.4% of patients in the 6 mg/kg NPC-21, 12 mg/kg NPC-21, and placebo groups, respectively

Result_Outcome.evidence: CMV disease occurred in 4.1% of the combined NPC-21 group versus 13.2% in the placebo group, with an absolute difference of −9.1 (95% CI −23.9 to 2.8).

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were observed after NPC-21 administration.
